Molasses, or black treacle is a viscous by-product of refining sugarcane or sugar 
beets into sugar. Molasses varies by amount of sugar, method of extraction, and 
age of plant. Molasses is primarily used for sweetening and flavoring foods. ... To 
make molasses, sugar cane is harvested and stripped of leaves. Its juice is...
